channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Supercharge Your Network: 5 Tips to Jumpstart Old Connections
item.description: Here are some tips to bring your "rusty relationships" back to life.

item.title: Meta will produce its Quest 3S next-generation VR and AR headsets in Vietnam
item.description: The announcement comes as Vietnam looks to boost its attractiveness as a destination for investment by the world's biggest companies and a key part of the global supply chain.

item.title: NRA targets Sen Sherrod Brown in 7-figure ad buy in Ohio: 'Vote like your life depends on it'
item.description: The National Rifle Association Political Victory Fund is ramping up its influence in swing state Ohio with a new seven-figure ad campaign aimed at Democrat Sen. Sherrod Brown.

item.title: House subpoenas Mayorkas over Walz's alleged ties to Chinese Communist Party
item.description: House lawmakers Monday subpoenaed the Homeland Security Department over whistleblower disclosures "raising serious concerns" about Democratic Vice Presidential candidate Tim Walz's purported ties to the Chinese Communist Party.

item.title: Government Overreach Is a Blight upon Property Rights
item.description: Nationwide, authorities are blocking owners from protecting their property from demolition, stripping them of their rights.

item.title: Kamala Harris Doesn’t Care About White People
item.description: Hurricane Helene should be Harris’ 'Katrina moment,' but it won’t be because the victims are white Trump supporters.

item.title: For Plan Sponsors: Understanding Investment Vehicles and Fees
item.description: Plan sponsors would be wise to focus on investment vehicle choice and fee structure. Share class choice impacts fees and investment performance.

item.title: U.S. economy is on the cusp of another Roaring ’20s, says UBS
item.description: "It’s quite possible that by early 2025 only the most pessimistic investors will need rose-colored glasses to see a clear path to a Roaring ‘20s outcome." The question is how long it will last.

item.title: Montana GOP Senate candidate Sheehy says he was in Afghanistan while Jon Tester was 'eating lobbyist steak'
item.description: Montana GOP U.S. Senate candidate Tim Sheehy criticized his opponent, incumbent Democrat Sen. Jon Tester, for his ties to lobbyists during a debate.

item.title: On eve of vice presidential debate, recalling the Palin-Biden contest
item.description: So the vice presidential debate is finally ready to roll. The 90-minute encounter between Sen. J.D. Vance, Ohio Republican, and Democratic Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz is set for 9 p.m. Eastern time Tuesday on CBS, though other networks will be simulcasting. But wait. Let's journey back 16 years to consider an event of yore. Then-Sen. Joe Biden of Delaware and then-Alaska Gov. Sarah Palin faced off in a vice presidential debate on Oct. 2, 2008.

item.title: Kamala Harris, Faux Border Hawk
item.description: On immigration, as so much else, she wants to be something she’s not.

item.title: Leaked Call: AZ Democrat Officials Feared Voter List Error Would ‘Validate’ GOP Concerns About ‘Illegal Voting’
item.description: 'When this goes public ... it's going to validate all of their theories about illegal voting,' Katie Hobbs worried before asserting such theories are 'not true.'

item.title: So, You Want to be an Investment Consultant?
item.description: Investment consulting is continually evolving. As technology evolves, so will our approaches, yet the core of consulting -- relationship-driven, strategic advice -- will remain steadfast..

item.title: These eerily prescient words from Hollywood icon Sharon Stone might have foretold the Chappell Roan fiasco
item.description: "Nobody likes you when you have boundaries,” the Basic Instinct star said last year.

item.title: Pennsylvania absentee voting underway in some counties
item.description: Mail ballots are available in some of Pennsylvania's 67 counties. The state's 19 Electoral College votes are considered critical for candidates running for president in 2024.

item.title: Harris, Trump turn focus to Hurricane Helene relief efforts
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump shifted their attention Monday away from standard campaigning to focus on the emergency response to the fallout from Hurricane Helene, which devastated a region that includes the election battleground states of North Carolina and Georgia.

item.title: Eric Adams Indictment Reveals Additional China Trip with Beijing-Tied Aide
item.description: The aide, Winnie Greco, was also facilitating Chinese delegations’ visits to New York City, NR has learned.

item.title: How Does Nevada Keep Bad Actors From Abusing Its Insecure Online Voting System? Officials Can’t Say
item.description: Nevada appears to be using an honor system to determine a voter's eligibility for EASE, the state's electronic voting program.

item.title: Book Excerpt: Trailblazers, Heroes, and Crooks
item.description: We rely on autopilots in investing. Stephen Foerster draws on lessons from aviation to demonstrate that we often don't understand how they work and their limitations.

item.title: Google will invest $1 billion in Thailand to build new infrastructure for AI and cloud computing
item.description: Google's expansion in Thailand will add $4 billion to the kingdom's GDP by 2029 and support 14,000 jobs between 2025 and 2029, the company said, citing a report from consultancy Deloitte.

item.title: Heightened 'significance and importance' as Vance, Walz face off in VP debate
item.description: With a 2nd face-to-face showdown between Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Trump unlikely, there's a lot on the line in the vice presidential debate with five weeks until Election Day

item.title: Judge strikes down Georgia ban on abortions, allowing them to resume beyond 6 weeks into pregnancy
item.description: A Georgia judge on Monday struck down the state's abortion law, which took effect in 2022 and effectively prohibited abortions beyond about six weeks of pregnancy.

item.title: Is Tim Walz Actually a ‘Permission’ Slip for White-Dude Voters?
item.description: Progressives have bet a little too much on this idea.

item.title: Democrat Senate Candidates Endorse Keeping LGBT Radicalism In The Military
item.description: Arizona's Ruben Gallego and Texas' Colin Allred endorsed keeping LGBT radicalism in the U.S. military on Friday.

item.title: Book Review: The Puzzle of Sustainable Investment
item.description: Lukasz Pomorski adeptly discusses the good, the bad, and the unknown of sustainable investing while acknowledging that the answer to some of the critical questions is the dreaded “it depends.”

item.title: Sizzler offers chance for free steak for a year
item.description: But contest is only open to people in a few states.

item.title: Jimmy Carter becomes first president to turn 100
item.description: Former Democrat President Carter became the oldest president to ever live, celebrating his 100th birthday on Tuesday.

item.title: Jim Jordan wants to grill FBI contractor who created 'Trump questionnaire'
item.description: House Judiciary Committee Chairman Jim Jordan on Monday called for testimony from an FBI contractor who created a questionnaire asking bureau employees to reveal if their colleagues supported former President Donald Trump.

item.title: Kris Kristofferson Was Great at Singing but Supremely Lousy at Politics
item.description: The singer was an apologist for some of the world’s worst regimes.

item.title: FEMA Website Admits Keeping You Alive In A Natural Disaster Isn’t Its Top Priority
item.description: Residents of flooded out towns across Appalachia have been forced to rely on charity relief efforts instead of the federal government.
